instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LCD_PWR_EN: What is LCD_PWR_EN? LCD_PWR_EN is a signal that tells the chip that supplies power to the LCD screen to turn on..
definitions.PPVCORE_GPU: What is PPVCORE_GPU? This is the main power rail for the GPU. This is required for the GPU to turn on so you can get image on the display. .
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hey,

i got a 15" MBP (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) with no display an no backlight. <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL> looks fine (1.06V) but <SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is missing (no short to ground). I got USB activity but no image on external display.
Could it be a faulty GPU?

Thanks and best regards

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Missing internal and external image at same time, points to graphics issue.
Try PRAM reset 2-3 times first.
And resolder <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> with leaded solder, as usual in this board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Just did the resoldering and the pram reset but no changes.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>
threads.message: There is an easy hardware mod to disable GPU om this board; search the forum.
